thread.title: News Minute: Here is the latest New Hampshire news from The Associated Press
thread.title_full: News Minute: Here is the latest New Hampshire news from The Associated Press - WCAX.COM Local Vermont News, Weather and Sports-

author: wcax.com
title: News Minute: Here is the latest New Hampshire news from The Associated Press
text:
MAINE:
PORTLAND, Maine (AP) - A U.S. bankruptcy judge has approved a $338 million settlement fund for victims of a fiery oil train derailment that claimed 47 lives in Quebec. Judge Peter Cary in Portland, Maine, announced his decision today. A runaway train with 72 oil tankers derailed on July 6th, 2013, in Lac Megantic, Quebec, setting off powerful explosions and causing raging fires.
BIDDEFORD, Maine (AP) - School officials say a high school student in Maine has been diagnosed with viral meningitis. WGME-TV reports Biddeford High School sent a note to parents Thursday saying they're asking students to wash their hands often, cough into their sleeves and not share drinks or utensils to help prevent the disease from spreading. The school nurse is asking parents to keep their kids home if they show symptoms including fever, stiff neck or unusual fatigue. Viral meningitis is not as serious as bacterial meningitis.
BOSTON (AP) - Amtrak says it will now allow passengers on some Northeast routes to bring along their pets. Under the program, passengers can take a cat or small dog on trips up to seven hours long. The service is available on the Boston to Lynchburg, Newport News, and Norfolk, Virginia, on the Northeast Regional service lines, as well from Boston to Brunswick, Maine, on the Downeaster route. Pet owners will have to pay an extra $25 to make a reservation. The service begins Monday.
BANGOR, Maine (AP) - A former Bowdoinham man accused of downloading sexually explicit images and videos of children has pleaded guilty to charges. Daniel Lajoie Jr. pleaded guilty Thursday in federal court in Bangor to a charge of possession of child pornography. Court records show the Department of Homeland Security suspected the 46-year-old Lajoie was sharing sexually explicit videos of children online.
NEW HAMPSHIRE:
CONCORD, N.H. (AP) - New Hampshire's Department of Corrections says an inmate serving a prison sentence for theft returned to a Concord halfway house hours after leaving without permission. Fifty-year-old Robert Mozeika, of Chichester, left the men's North End Transitional Housing Unit on Thursday around noon to go to work. He returned at about midnight and was moved to the state prison.
CONCORD, N.H. (AP) - A new poll shows that 50 percent of New Hampshire residents surveyed think Congressman Frank Guinta should resign amid his campaign finance troubles, and 4 percent said they would back his re-election bid next year. The Republican said the $355,000 he reported loaning himself for his 2010 campaign was his because for years he contributed to and managed a "family pot" of money. The Federal Election Commission concluded Guinta broke the law by accepting donations above the legal limit from his parents and fined him.
CONCORD, N.H. (AP) - President Barack Obama has nominated Emily Gray Rice to serve as U.S. Attorney for New Hampshire. U.S. Senators Jeanne Shaheen and Kelly Ayotte said Thursday they would support Rice, who would need to be confirmed by the Senate. Rice would replace acting U.S. Attorney Donald Feith.
COLUMBUS, Ohio (AP) - Ohio Governor John Kasich (KAY'-sik) is planning several stops across New Hampshire and Vermont as he campaigns for the Republican presidential nomination. The governor's campaign says the four-day bus tour will start today with an event in Concord. Kasich then plans to hold a town hall in Stratham before heading to a GOP dinner and reception in Burlington, Vermont. The bus tour will resume on Monday and wrap up Wednesday.
VERMONT:
WASHINGTON (AP) - With the first Democratic presidential debate approaching this Tuesday, Bernie Sanders' campaign team suggests the Vermont senator has a simple plan: "Let Bernie be Bernie." Aides say a key goal is introducing Sanders' personal story to a wider audience and show he could be Democrats' strongest nominee.
WASHINGTON (AP) - Democratic presidential hopeful Hillary Clinton's newly unveiled plan to crack down on Wall Street abuses may not go far enough for liberal party members. Rival Bernie Sanders is among the lawmakers seeking the revival of a law banning financial institutions from combining their commercial banking with investment banking.
COLUMBUS, Ohio (AP) - Ohio Governor John Kasich (KAY'-sik) is planning several stops across Vermont and New Hampshire as he campaigns for the Republican presidential nomination. The governor's campaign says the four-day bus tour will start today with an event in Concord, New Hampshire. Kasich then plans to hold a town hall in Stratham, New Hampshire, before heading to a GOP dinner and reception in Burlington, Vermont. The bus tour will resume on Monday and wrap up Wednesday.
MONTPELIER, Vt. (AP) - Members of the Veterans of Foreign Wars in Barre have honored three men with a prestigious lifesaving award after they intervened during a shooting that killed a Department of Children and Families worker. Washington County State's Attorney Scott Williams, former State's Attorney Greg McNaughton, and Andy Hockman were honored at a Statehouse ceremony yesterday. Investigators say Jody Herring was enraged at having lost custody of a child and hunted down DCF worker Lara Sobel who was involved in her case.
